101.description: Building a chatbot from scratch using TensorFlow and explaining how chatbots actually work.
101.title: The ML behind Chatbots: under the hood

201.description: ¡Attención por favor! After attending this event you will be very confident in Android interviews. If you want to get the cheat sheet, learn about trending Android technologies (Kotlin, RxJava) and best practices, about organizational cultures in Android teams, don't miss this session!
201.title: Tech trends in Android and how to crack Android interviews

102.description: Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning is the new, exciting thing - we're going to lean how it works, and how to apply it in real world situations including games, chatbots, and image recognition.
102.title: Unity ML Agents

202.description: Application architecture defines the way we develop, test, scale and maintain our application. Good architecture allows us to easily adopt to constantly changing requirements and protects us from breaking existing functionalities. Igor will introduce the concept of Clean Architecture, discuss it's benefits and helps you understand how Clean Architecture fits into Android application development.
202.title: Clean Architecture

103.title: Building conversational experiences with Actions on Google

221.description: Make your conversational AI platforms and chatbots perform better. What are the challenges behind NLP/NLC data model; who are the key players; why do you need to measure performance; Demo of QBox, the technology-agnostic corpus-management tool that allows you to quantify the quality of your natural-language model.
221.title: How to make your Conversional AI (chatbot) platform work

222.title: Building, Hosting and Monitoring a web service with GCP and Stackdriver

141.title: Lightning Talk - AR in the browser

310.title: Tea, coffee, registration (pick up your swagbag!)

speakers.name: Ming Gao
speakers.title: Senior Data Scientist
speakers.shortBio: Ming Gao, Senior Data Scientist at UserReplay, where he is leading data science practice and building analytical products.
speakers.bio: Ming Gao, Senior Data Scientist at UserReplay, where he is leading data science practice and building analytical products. Prior to UserReplay, he was a management consultant at AlixPartners and R&D manager at DigitalMR. He holds a PhD from Reading University on the modelling and analysis of imbalanced data problems. He is passionate about utilizing machine learning and advanced analytics to solve complex real-world problems and making impact in industry

speakers.name: Joe Reeve
speakers.title: Freelance consultant
speakers.bio: Joe is a freelance consultant who uses IT to solve business' problems. He also organises and speak at various events on many topics, including Photography, Web Development, and Problem Solving.
speakers.shortBio: Joe is a freelance consultant who uses IT to solve business' problems

speakers.name: Kübra Harmankaya
speakers.title: Android Developer
speakers.bio: Kübra founded her startup Innova Ocean Limited and she is a Mobile and Agile Consultant in London. She develops user friendly and performant mobile applications in a wide range of sectors. She is obsessed with code quality, team work and trending technologies. Kübra has been a Google Developer Groups Lead for 4 years and a Women Techmakers Lead for 2 years. She loves sharing experiences with communities all around the world. She has special interests in Agile Methodologies and Scrum Framework
speakers.shortBio: Kübra is a Mobile and Agile Consultant in London; Women Techmaker and GDG lead.

speakers.name: Steven Gray
speakers.title: Senior Teaching Fellow
speakers.bio: A hard working, self-motivated, software engineer with over 10 years professional experience in both commercial and research settings who enjoys working as one or as part of a dedicated team, applying my knowledge to new situations. I enjoy teaching others, learning new skills and playing an active part in projects undertaken. Keen to find elegant, precise and effective solutions to problems that arise. I maintain an acute attention to detail and am able to learn new technologies and languages quickly. An excellent communicator who has an energetic personality and strives to improve his skills continually.
speakers.shortBio: I enjoy teaching others, learning new skills and playing an active part in projects undertaken.

speakers.name: Nana Fifield
speakers.title: Head of Product Development
speakers.bio: Nana has extensive Software Engineering and Management expertise, spanning 20+ years, gained while working in numerous and diverse industries including telecommunications, investment banking, aerospace, software education and business operations management
speakers.shortBio: Nana is a GDG Lead and the head of product development at Sage

speakers.name: Chris Guest
speakers.title: SRE
speakers.bio: Highly motivated and dedicated Engineer, with domain knowledge ranging from IPTV to Games and Anti-Virus. Passionate about product & service engineering with broad multi-discipline experience of Development, Test and Operations. Demonstrated leadership and technical skills with confidence to engage at all levels of an organisation. Holds an ethos for continuous personal improvement and learning, whilst understanding that it is important to achieve this within a community peers
speakers.shortBio: Highly motivated and dedicated Engineer, with domain knowledge ranging from IPTV to Games and Anti-Virus. Passionate about product & service engineering with broad multi-discipline experience of Development, Test and Operations. Demonstrated leadership and technical skills with confidence to engage at all levels of an organisation. Holds an ethos for continuous personal improvement and learning, whilst understanding that it is important to achieve this within a community peers

speakers.name: Benoit Alvarez
speakers.title: CTO
speakers.bio: As Volume’s Chief Technology Officer (CTO), Benoit manages the UK Innovation Hub and Sri Lankan development centre – a team of 40 people including Data scientist, AI developers, UX developers, C#/ASP.NET developers and Product Owners. Clients include Dell, Virgin Media, HP Inc., HP enterprise, Plantronics, BP, Oracle and Bureau Veritas. Over the last 2 years, he focused in AI, conversional AI platform and especially the problematic of measuring and improving the quality of natural language data model. Benoit graduated from Bourges University in France with a Masters in Digital Design Engineering in 1998. He worked for the International Centre of Radio Astronomy in Nançay and for Thales Armament, before completing another Masters in 2001 in software design and development. After three years working in the startup and insurance industries, Benoit moved to the UK, join Intelligum Ltd, an independent software company developing bespoke software solutions for a range of clients. In 2005 Intelligum was acquired by Volume. In 2016, he passed a Machine Learning certification from Stanford University. For the last 12 months, Benoit has been working on QBox.ai

speakers.name: Atif Khan
speakers.title: Radio Network and Optimisation Engineer
speakers.bio: Senior Radio and Access Transmission Engineer with over nine years experience in functionality, strategy, architecture, optimisation, characterisation, end 2 end performance, software testing, operations etc. Experience with three different operators (Ericsson, Alcatel Lucent/ Nortel, Nokia) on two different Radio Networks (GSM and UMTS) across radio and access transmission domain.
speakers.shortBio: Senior Radio and Access Transmission Engineer with over nine years experience in functionality, strategy, architecture, optimisation, characterisation, end 2 end performance, software testing, operations etc. Experience with three different operators (Ericsson, Alcatel Lucent/ Nortel, Nokia) on two different Radio Networks (GSM and UMTS) across radio and access transmission domain.

speakers.name: Dan Norris-Jones
speakers.title: Director and co-founder
speakers.bio: Co-founder of Priocept. Software engineer, mechanical engineer, pilot, race driver, hunter/guardian of old Porsches
speakers.shortBio: Co-founder of Priocept. Software engineer, mechanical engineer, pilot, race driver, hunter/guardian of old Porsches

speakers.name: Igor Wojda
speakers.title: Android Engineer
speakers.bio: Igor Wojda is an experienced engineer with over 11 years of software development experience. Currently, he is working as Android Engineer at babylon. Igor was one of Kotln early adopters. He is a speaker, technical proffer for Kotlin In Action book and author of Android Development with Kotlin book. He enjoys sharing his passion for coding with other developers.
speakers.shortBio: Passionate engineer with over eleven years of experience in software development. Trainer and author of ‘Android Development with Kotlin’ book.

speakers.name: Nawaid Shamim
speakers.title: System Engineer
speakers.bio: Nawaid designs, develops and maintains web services for various Playstation games including Little Big Planet, Kill Zone - Shadow Fall, and Tearaway. Nawaid currently lives in London, where he advocates and evangelises for cloud computing and has a keen interest in distributed systems, machine learning and automation
